author: craigmcc
msg: As an aid to developers migrating from Struts 0.5, provide a deprecated
version of the perform() method that matches the old signature.  Otherwise,
if you forget to change an action, its perform() method will not be called,
and it is difficult to understand why.
Submitted by:  Pierre Metras <genepi@sympatico.ca>

author: craigmcc
msg: Enhance the usefulness of the "attribute" attribute on the <actino> element.
If a previous ActionForm instance is found at the specified attribute in the
specified scope, but it is not of the appropriate Java class, simply replace
it with a new instance of the appropriate class (rather than having an
application action later throw a ClassCastException).  Among other things, this
allows an application using session scope to maintain ActionForm beans to reuse
the same session attribute key for many ActionForms, thereby reducing the
potential for bloat in the session attributes.
Submitted by: Erwin Brinkhuis <Erwin.Brinkhuis@iWise.nl>

author: craigmcc
msg: Correct typos in the TLD.
Submitted by: David Winterfeldt <dwinterfeldt@yahoo.com>

author: craigmcc
msg: Correctly process the "nocache" initialization parameter.
Submitted by:  Jay Walters <jwalters@netnumina.com> and
Ralph Schaer <schaer@ess.ch>

author: craigmcc
msg: Make the call to the validate() method of a form bean optional, by adding
a new "validate" attribute on the <action> element.  You would typically
set this to false on actions that simply set up request and session scope
beans for a subsequent JSP page, rather than processing input forms.
The default value of the "validate" attribute is "true".
